forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 80. Southwest wind around 13 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Chance Showers And Thunderstorms
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers between 3am and 5am, then a chance of showers and thunderstorms. Mostly cloudy. Low around 60, with temperatures rising to around 66 overnight. Southwest wind 10 to 14 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The afternoon in Boston unveils itself beneath a cloak of soft blue sky, punctuated by wisps of clouds that dance lazily above. The air carries a promise of warmth, swelling with the gentle greetings of a southwest breeze. As you venture outside, you’ll find a delightful reprieve from the ordinary; temperatures hover around a comfortable 80 degrees, inviting late-season revelries. This is the kind of day where a stroll along the Charles River seems just right, perhaps with a book tucked under your arm or a friend to share the moments with.

As dusk approaches, the clouds will gradually gather their strength, hinting at the possibility of rain and a rumble of thunder before the night falls. While the evening might urge you to seek shelter, the rising temperatures remind you that comfort is still at hand; a light jacket is all you need for the cool of night. Consider a visit to one of the cozy cafes tucked away in the North End, where rich espresso and the aroma of fresh pastries pair beautifully with the anticipation of the changes to come in the weather. In this transient moment between sunlight and twilight, Boston offers both vigor and the soft embrace of impending rain—a perfect transition into a delightful fall evening.
